String.Value: Online Document\nFor more detailed instructions, see the online documentation: {0}
Are you sure to quit the game?

How to edit enties? \n1. Open window > any localization in the menu bar \n2. Specify the XML Dictionary Path (the default location is the "Anylocalization / Dictionary" folder), and then you can view and edit the entries in the editor. You can also export all dictionaries as xlsx files and edit them with Excel.

How to add / remove a language? \nIn the Any Localization edit window, click the Languages button (upper right corner), and then select the language you want to use, in the new window. For your data security, if you want to remove a language, please manually delete the XML file corresponding to the language type under the XML dictionary path in Explorer

Overview\nAny Localization is a lightweight Unity plug-in that can help you quickly complete the text localization of unity applications.Any Localization has the characteristics of highly modular , friendly interaction , easy to expand . You can use it independently or easily embed it into any framework.
Auto Assignment:\nAdd the Auto Localization component after the Text / TexMesh Pro / TexMesh ProUGUI component, and select the key.
How to change language at run time?
Necessary:\nAdd the Any Localization component to yout first Scene.
